Articles.Content:
We'll I'll get right to introductions!

My name is Pascal and I'm from the Netherlands. I've been a long time KSP players, pretty much since it's earliest Alpha. I've been playing the game off and on ever since, pretty much giving every big patch another go. I'm currently completely hooked on 0.90 Beta then Ever. I've installed a couple of mods such as Interstellar, FAR, Karbonite, ScanSat etc to give me more things to do and I'm pretty much spending days upon days of designing more missions and infrastructure around Kerbin. My Kerbanauts haven't really made it out of the Kerbin SOI in 0.90 yet but hey.. They've been to every planet before then so I'm sure they can wait a bit longer while I deploy countless more satellites and probes all over Kerbol.

I've been a long time lurker on the forums but only recently started making posts of my own. So far it's been great and I have to say you guys are a wonderfully friendly and helpfull community.

What got me into KSP? Well... I've always been a sucker for space themed games. When I first caught word of KSP I emediatly rushed over to the website to buy a copy. I've also been following Scott Manley a fair bit on youtube and I'm always amazed at how he (as well as other youtubers such as HOCgaming and all that) get such intricate networks of infrastructure or such huge and well designed ships into orbit. I've been trying to get to that level of skill but even though I'm a long term player, there's always more to learn and improve on in KSP wich is what makes this game so great.

I'm deffinitly not a math wizard so doing all those complicated Dv or ISP calculations is well beyond me. But there's mods to fix that and the game itself is beautifully simple and easy to learn, but oh so difficult to master. I'm still looking to learn though and even though physics is far removed from my everyday occupation it does interrest me to a huge extent.

Hoping to have a fun time on the forums!

I also don't do the math. I use trial and error.

Welcome to the forum.
